metadata.title: CVE-2017-13168 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An elevation of privilege vulnerability in the kernel scsi driver. Product:Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID A-65023233.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-162-generic - 3.13.0-162.212
linux-image-3.13.0-162-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-162.212
linux-image-3.13.0-162-lowlatency - 3.13.0-162.212
linux-image-3.13.0-162-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-162.212
linux-image-3.13.0-162-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-162.212
linux-image-3.13.0-162-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-162.212
linux-image-3.13.0-162-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-162.212
linux-image-3.13.0-162-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-162.212
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-162-generic - 3.13.0-162.212
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-134-generic - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-lowlatency - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-134-generic - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1028-aws - 4.4.0-1028.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1031-azure - 4.15.0-1031.32~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-162.212').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1028.31').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.32~14.04.1').
